column26: Illumina NovaSeq 6000 sequencing; RNAseq of Arabidopsis seedlings of either wt or hsl3-1, in response to a 30 minute treatment of 100 nM CTNIP4 relative to mock
column27: RNAseq of Arabidopsis seedlings of either wt or hsl3-1, in response to a 30 minute treatment of 100 nM CTNIP4 relative to mock
column28: Illumina NovaSeq 6000 sequencing; RNAseq of Arabidopsis seedlings of either wt or hsl3-1, in response to a 30 minute treatment of 100 nM CTNIP4 relative to mock
column29: Protocols: Two 3-day-old seedlings per well were transferred into transparent 24-well plates containing 1 mL liquid MS media, sealed with porous tape and grown for a further 9 days. Media was then exchanged for 500 µL fresh MS media and left overnight. In the morning a further 480 µL of fresh media was added. 9.5 h later 20 µL treatment/mock was added and seedlings were harvested after 30 min. Mock treatment was with water. All seedlings were ground in liquid nitrogen.     Arabidopsis thaliana seeds grown on plates were surface sterilized using chlorine gas for 5–6 h and sown on 1/2 Murashige and Skoog (MS) media, 1 % sucrose, and 0.8 % agar and stratified at 4 °C for 2–3 days. Plates were then transferred to 22 °C under a 16-h photoperiod.  Total RNA was extracted using Trizol reagent according to the manufacturer’s instructions and DNAase treatment/RNA cleanup was performed using the RNeasy kit. Library prep and sequencing were performed by Novogene using a NEB Next® Ultra™ RNA Library Prep Kit
